section.title: Certificate of Deposit
section.para: Certificate of Deposit module enables you to access Treasury Certificate of Deposit module Presentation page provided by . The Certificate of Deposit module is used to initiate a Certificate of Deposit (CD) transaction, provide maturity/interest payment, and withdrawal instructions. The bank and customer can also make inquiry on the CD transaction which has been created in the .

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Certificate of Deposit Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Creates and submits a Certificate of Deposit request.

Provides a set of functions for making amendments to a transaction and managing standing instructions attached to the transaction. You can add, edit, and release customer and bank payment instructions, process rollover on a Certificate of Deposit.
Enables you to view all the existing CD Initiations that are not yet complete or have not been submitted.
Displays the list of existing CD transactions that are approved by the bank along with the status of the transactions. You can view the details and optionally print a hard copy of these details.
Provides a set of functions to carry out maintenance tasks such as set entity, set references, maintain unsigned, maintain purged, and maintain rejected CD transactions.

section.title: Initiation
section.para: This section describes the forms used in the Initiation menu.

section.title: Initiation Options
section.para: The Initiation menu provides the Certificate of Deposit option to initiate and submit a Certificate of Deposit trade request.

section.title: Creating a Certificate of Deposit Request
section.para: Using the Initiation menu, you can create a Certificate of Deposit request as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under Initiation, click Certificate of Deposit. The Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

Enter details in the General Details, Applicant Details, Bank Details, and Request For Deposit sections. For more information about the fields in each section, refer to the Initiation - Certificate of Deposit section.
Click Request to request for the Certificate of Deposit. To clear the details, click Clear.

note.para: Only manual pricing is supported for Certificate of Deposit. The trader can modify the rate and add comments and send the price to . If the trader chooses to refuse the price, the following message is displayed: Your request has been rejected along with trader's comments, if any. For more information about the rate pooling process, see the Rate Pooling for a Certificate of Deposit topic.

listitem.para:
A confirmation message that your request is being processed is displayed. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to attempt a submission of the input data. Are you sure?
To confirm the submission, click OK. The Validating and Processing progress bar appears. If you have:
Sufficient privileges to submit the standing instructions, the record is submitted to the treasury back office, the Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears with a message indicating that the Certificate of Deposit TDxxxxxxxxxxxxxx has been successfully released to the bank with a link Review and print the transaction details link.
Insufficient privileges to submit the standing instructions, the record is only saved and not submitted to the treasury back office, the Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears with the following message: Due to insufficient privileges, the Standing Instruction for Certificate of Deposit TDxxxxxxxxxxxxxx has been successfully saved but not released to the bank. Please ask the authorized person to release it.
For more information about the details displayed in the Review and print the transaction details link, see the following section.
To cancel the submission, click Cancel. The Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

section.para: To leave the current page without editing and submitting the record, click Cancel. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to leave the current page. Are you sure?

listitem.para: To confirm the cancellation, click OK. The Treasury Certificate of Deposit Module Presentation page appears.
To cancel the cancellation, click Cancel. The Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

note.para: If you need to clear the details and specify different values, click Clear.

section.title: Rate Pooling for a Certificate of Deposit
section.para: The rate pooling process for a Certificate of Deposit is as follows:

listitem.para: When you click Request, the request flows to the treasury back office for manual pricing. The following message is displayed: Your request is being processed, please wait. To cancel the request, click Cancel. The Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page is displayed with data as entered in the request form.

When the rate pooling cycle is in progress, a confirmation message is displayed: Do you want to continue to wait? Click Continue to continue to wait. Click Cancel to cancel the request. The Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page is displayed with data as entered in the request form.
When the rate pooling is complete, the Contract Details popup window appears. The timer is displayed with an option to Accept or Reject. If you click,
Accept within the specified time limit, the following message is displayed: "You are going to attempt submission of the current transaction. Are you sure?". If you click Ok:
before the time expires, then the transaction details are sent to the treasury back office and the trade is moved to the Add Instructions queue.
after the time has expired, then the following message is displayed: "The rate is no longer valid. Your transaction has been refused.
If the specified time to accept the price has expired and you select Cancel, then the price request window is displayed. Only the Reject button is enabled.
Reject before or after the time is expired, then the following warning message is displayed: "You are about to reject the request. Are you sure?"

To reject the request, click Yes. The request is rejected and the Create a New Treasury Certificate of Deposit page is displayed with the values entered in the previous request. You can re-submit the request.

To cancel the request, click Cancel. The Contract Details popup window is displayed. The timer is displayed if the specified time to accept the price has not expired with an option to Accept or Reject the price. If the specified time to accept the price has expired and you select Cancel then the Contract Details window is displayed. Only the Reject button is enabled.

section.para: For more information about the Contract Details section, refer to the Initiation - Contract Details section.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the forms used in the Message to Bank menu.

section.title: Message to Bank Options
section.para:
The Message to Bank menu provides the following functions to send a free-format message to the treasury back office. You can add, edit, and release payment instructions to the Certificate of Deposit request.
Add Instructions
Enables to add settlement instructions for Certificate of Deposit transactions.
From Existing CDs
Processes rollovers for the Certificate of Deposit transactions.
Edit Transactions
Enables to modify and submit the instructions.
Retrieve Unsigned
Enables to review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted to bank due to insufficient privileges.

section.title: Message to Bank - Add Instructions
section.para: The Add Instructions function can be used to view all the pending settlement instructions for the Certificate of Deposit transactions even if one leg of the instruction is pending.

section.title: Adding Instructions to a Certificate of Deposit Request
section.para: You can add instructions to a Certificate of Deposit request as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under Message to Bank, click Add Instructions. The List of Transactions Awaiting Instructions page appears.

Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, and Ccy fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed. For more information about the displayed columns, refer to the Add Instructions Selection section.
Click the System ID associated to a record to open a record. The Create a Standing Instructions Message page appears.

You can only view the General Details section. Edit the Customer Payment Instructions and Bank Payment Instructions sections. For more information about the fields displayed in these sections, refer to the Add Instructions - General Details, Add Instructions - Customer Payment Instructions, and Add Instructions - Bank Payment Instructions sections.
Click Submit to submit the record. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to attempt a submission of the input data. Are you sure?
To confirm the submission, click OK. The Validating and Processing progress bar appears. If you have:

Sufficient privileges to submit the standing instructions, the record is submitted to the treasury back office, the Submit Certificate of Deposit Standing Instruction page appears with a message indicating that the Certificate of Deposit TDxxxxxxxxxxxxxx has been successfully released to the bank with a Review and print the transaction details link.

Insufficient privileges to submit the standing instructions, the record is only saved and not submitted to the treasury back office, the Submit Certificate of Deposit Standing Instruction page appears with the following message: Due to insufficient privileges, the Standing Instruction for Certificate of Deposit TDxxxxxxxxxxxxxx has been successfully saved but not released to the bank. Please ask the authorized person to release it.
For more information about the details displayed in the Review and print the transaction details link, see the following section.
To cancel the submission, click Cancel. The Create a Standing Instructions Message page appears.

section.para: To leave the current page without editing and submitting the record, click Cancel. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to leave the current page. Are you sure?

listitem.para: To confirm the cancellation, click OK. The Treasury Certificate of Deposit Module Presentation page appears.
To cancel the cancellation, click Cancel. The Create a Standing Instructions Message page appears.

The link displays the following details: Event Details, General Details, Bank Details, and Settlement Details. The trade is no longer displayed in the Add instructions menu. The transaction details include Event details, where the Transaction Type is Amend Instructions and the Status is Controlled.

section.title: Message to Bank - Edit Transactions
section.para: This option allows you to retrieve, edit, and submit the instructions that are attached to a Certificate of Deposit transaction. This option presents a list of Message to Bank records that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the treasury back office because the input user either did not submit or had insufficient privileges.

section.title: Editing a Certificate of Deposit Transaction
section.para: You can edit a Certificate of Deposit transaction as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under Message to Bank, click Edit Instructions. The List of Draft Treasury Certificate of Deposit Transactions page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, and Ccy fields are displayed.
Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed. For more information about the displayed columns, refer to the Add Instructions Selection section.
Click the System ID associated to a record to open a record. The Open Draft Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

You can only view the General Details section. Edit the Customer Payment Instructions and Bank Payment Instructions sections. For more information about the fields displayed in these sections, refer to the Add Instructions - General Details, Add Instructions - Customer Payment Instructions, and Add Instructions - Bank Payment Instructions sections. 5. Click Submit to submit the record. .
Click Submit to submit the record. To save the record, click Save. To cancel the editing and submission of the record, click Cancel.

section.para: For more information about the Search Options and the fields displayed in the Open Draft Treasury Certificate Deposit and the Action buttons page, see the Message to Bank - Add Instructions section.

section.title: Message to Bank - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows you to display the Message to Bank records that have not been submitted to the bank due to insufficient privileges. These records are displayed under the Retrieve Unsigned menu. The users who have sufficient privileges to release the instructions can access these records and submit the instructions.

section.title: Submitting a saved Certificate of Deposit
section.para: You can submit a Certificate of Deposit transaction from the Retrieve Unsigned menu as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under Message to Bank, click Retrieve Unsigned. The List of Unsigned Treasury Certificate of Deposit Transactions page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, and Ccy fields are displayed.

Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed. The columns displayed are as follows: System ID, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Debit Account, Beneficiary Name, Beneficiary Account, Ccy, Amount, Value Date, Deal Type, Input, and Users.
Place a tick in the check box to select a record. Click Submit to submit the record.

note.para: To select all the records, place a tick in the check box in the left side of the System Id column.

section.para: For more information about the fields displayed in the Open Unsigned Foreign Exchange page, see the Message to Bank - Add Instructions section.

section.title: Message to Bank - From Existing CDs
section.para: The From Existing CD function enables you to split the original transaction into multiple transactions. The original deal can be split multiple times before the value date of the deal and before the instructions are authorized.

section.title: Processing a Rollover of Certificate of Deposit Transaction
section.para: You can process a payment split as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under Message to Bank, click From Existing CDs. The List of Existing Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, and Ccy fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed. For more information about the displayed columns, refer to the From Existing CDs Selection.
Click the System ID associated to a record to open a record. The Update Existing Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears.

You can only view the General Details section. Select Rollover from the Actions drop-down list in the Action Details section. The Rollover Request section is displayed. For more information about the fields displayed in this section, refer to the From Existing CD - Rollover Request section.
Enter details in the Rollover Request section.

Click Request to request a rollover of the Certificate of Deposit. The Contract Details window is displayed. For more information about the fields displayed in the Contract Details window, refer to the From Existing CDs - Contract Details section.

If you accept the rate within the specified time limit, the rollover request is submitted. For more information about the rate pooling process, see the Rate Pooling for a Certificate of Deposit topic. To clear the specified details, click Clear.

section.title: Pending CDs
section.para: This function displays a list of all Certificate of Deposit (CD) records that have not been approved by the bank and the ones that are in draft state.

section.title: Viewing Pending CDs
section.para: You can inquiry about a CD as follows:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, click Pending CD. The List of Pending Treasury Certificate of Deposit Transactions page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields are displayed.

Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed. To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. For more information about the displayed columns, refer to the Pending CD - Selection section.
You can perform the following actions:
To view the Event Details of a transaction, click the Details of the file lookup icon.

To edit a transaction, click the Open in Edit mode icon. The Open Draft Treasury Certificate of Deposit page appears. You can edit and submit the transaction. For more information about how to edit the transaction, refer to the Certificate of Deposit - Edit Transactions section.
To view an editable record in control mode, click the Open in Control mode icon.

note.para: Only Draft and Incomplete (unauthorized) entries can be edited by clicking the edit icon in the left hand column of the entry. Submitted entries can only be viewed.

If you are attached to more than one, click the magnifying glass icon to select one. If you are attached to only one, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed. This field is hidden if there are no entities mapped to the customer. The magnifying glass displays all the entities mapped to the customer.

section.para: Each record is shown with one or more action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status. The Lookup button displays the Event Details, General Details, Applicant Details, Bank Details, Contract Details, and Settlement Details. The History button displays the history of the file. The history of the file includes the Consolidated Summary View and the Foreign Exchange Inquiry - History section. The View in Control Mode button displays an editable record in Control mode. (View only) . Only Draft and Incomplete (unauthorized) entries can be edited by clicking the Edit icon in the left hand column of the entry. The Open Draft Treasury Fund Transfer page is displayed. You can edit and submit the pending fund transfer record. For more information about the action buttons, refer to the Initiation - FT Wires section. You can only view the submitted entries.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as MS-Excel file.

section.para: Use the CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingCD.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.

section.title: CD Maintenance
section.para: This function is used to maintain Certificate of Deposit trade records that were created but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: CD Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: The Set Entity function lists all the Fund Transfer transactions and associates an Entity with the record.
To set an entity:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under CD Maintenance, click Set Entity. The Update Treasury Certificate of Deposit Entities page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed.
Click the System ID associated to a record to open a record. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Entity page appears.
Enter an entity in the Entity field. To select the Entity using the magnifying glass icon:
Click the magnifying glass icon adjacent to the Entity field. The List of Entities popup window appears.
Enter a value in the Abbreviated Name and Name fields to refine the list.
Click Search. The list of entities appears.
Select the Abbreviate Name associated to a record to select an entity. The selected value is populated in the Entity field.
Click Submit to associate the entity to the record. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to attempt a submission of the input data. Are you sure?

To confirm the submission, click OK. The Update Treasury Certificate of Deposit Entities page appears with a message indicating that the entity for the selected transaction has been successfully updated with the specified entity.
To cancel the submission, click Cancel. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Entity page appears.
To leave the current page without associating an entity, click Cancel. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to leave the current page. Are you sure?
To confirm the cancellation, click OK. The Treasury Certificate of Deposit Module Presentation page appears.
To cancel the cancellation, click Cancel. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Entity page appears.

section.title: CD Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: The Set Reference function allows you to assign a customer reference to a Certificate of Deposit record that currently has none.
To set a reference:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under CD Maintenance, click Set Reference. The List of Treasury Certificate of Deposit without Customer Reference page appears. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields are displayed.
Click the System ID associated to a record to open a record. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Reference page appears.
Enter a reference in the Customer Reference field.
Click Submit to assign the reference to the record. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to attempt a submission of the input data. Are you sure?

To confirm the submission, click OK. The Update Customer Reference page appears with a message indicating that the entity for the selected transaction has been successfully updated with the specified reference.
To cancel the submission, click Cancel. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Reference page appears.
To leave the current page without associating an entity, click Cancel. The following confirmation message appears: You are going to leave the current page. Are you sure?
To confirm the cancellation, click OK. The Treasury Certificate of Deposit Module Presentation page appears.
To cancel the cancellation, click Cancel. The Change Treasury Certificate of Deposit Reference page appears.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: CD Maintenance - Unsigned CDs
section.para: The Unsigned FT function lists and optionally deletes unsigned (unauthorized) Certificate of Deposit transactions.
To delete a CD:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under CD Maintenance, click Unsigned CDs. The Maintenance of Treasury Certificate of Deposit Unsigned Transactions page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed.
Place a tick in the check box in the left side of the record to select a record. Click the Delete selected transactions to delete the record.

note.para: To select all the records, place a tick in the check box in the left side of the System Id column.

section.title: CD Maintenance - Purged CDs
section.para: The Purged FTs function lists and optionally deletes Certificate of Deposit transactions that have been marked as Purged by the treasury back office.
To delete a CD marked as purged:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under CD Maintenance, click Purged CDs. The Maintenance of Treasury Certificate of Deposit Purged Transactions page appears.
Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of records is displayed.
Place a tick in the check box in the left side of the record to select a record. Click the Delete selected transactions to delete the record.

note.para: To select all the records, place a tick in the check box in the left side of the System Id column.

section.title: CD Maintenance - Rejected CDs
section.para: The Rejected CDs lists and optionally deletes rejected transactions.
To list and delete a rejected:

listitem.para: On the Treasury Services menu, click Certificate of Deposit. In the Certificate of Deposit main menu, under CD Maintenance, click Rejected CDs. The Maintenance of Treasury Certificate of Deposit Not-issued (Rejected) Transactions page appears.

Click Search Options. The System Id, Entity, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields are displayed. Enter values in the required field and click Search. A list of Certificate of Deposit records that were submitted but rejected by the bank and have a Not Processed status are displayed.
Place a tick in the check box to select a record. Click the Delete selected transactions to delete the record.

note.para: To select all the records, place a tick in the check box in the left side of the System Id column.

listitem.para: Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as MS-Excel file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.

section.para: Use the CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingDCD.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
